First, we need to identify the King of Portuguese people in 1515. This was King Manuel I. 

Next, we need to determine if he had any familial ties to the Tudors. The Tudors were the English royal family during the 15th and 16th centuries. Specifically, we need to look for a connection to King Henry VII or King Henry VIII, who were ruling during this time period. 

It is known that King Manuel I had a sister named Leonor who married King João II of Portugal. King João II also had a daughter named Isabella who married King Manuel I. 

Now, we need to determine if any of these individuals had familial ties to the Tudors. King Henry VII had a daughter named Margaret Tudor who married King James IV of Scotland. The couple had a son named James V who later married Mary of Guise. Mary of Guise had a sister named Louise of Guise who married King Francisco I of France. King Francisco I of France was cousins with King Manuel I of Portugal. 

Therefore, we can conclude that King of Portuguese people in 1515 did have familial ties to the Tudors, as his cousin King Francisco I of France was connected to the Tudors through marriage. The answer is (A) yes.

It turns out that King Manuel I's sister, Isabella of Portugal, was married to King John II of England, who was the father of Henry VIII, one of the most prominent Tudor monarchs. Therefore, King Manuel I did have familial ties to the Tudors.
Hence, the answer is (A) yes.
